title: someCode methd with parameters a, b, and c

content.question: public int someCode(int a, int b, int c) { if ((a < b) && (b < c)) return a; if ((a >= b) && (b >= c)) return b; if ((a == b) || (a == c) || (b == c)) return c; } Which of the following best describes why this method does not compile?

choices.label: It is possible to reach the end of the method without returning a value.
The if statements must have else parts when they contain return statements.
Methods cannot have multiple return statements.
The third if statement is not reachable.

content.answer: It is possible to reach the end of the method without returning a value.

skill.text: 3.D: Explain why a code segment will not compile or work as intended and modify the code to correct the error.
